document_data.name: Grimskalle
document_data.mainbody: '''Grimskalle''' was a [[frost giant]] fortress located on the isle of [[Solstice]] in the [[Sea of Moving Ice]] in the [[Far North]]. It was later claimed by the goddess [[Auril]], as her personal domain when she resided on [[Toril]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: It was located dead center on the isle of Solstice, set between gardens of ice sculptures that were formed by the Frostmaiden's ice magic.
document_data.Structure: Grimskalle resembled an imposing skull, adorned with a horned crown. The entirety of its structure was formed of carved ice that emanated a mist of icy air, standing {{SI|600|ft}} tall from base to peak.

Interior.Atmosphere: Due to its giant origins, the interior layout and furniture set within the build were built to enormous scale.

document_data.History:
The imposing fortress was originally built for the frost giant queen [[Vassavicken]].

Auril the Frostmaiden hid herself away within Grimskalle while her form appeared on [[Toril]] during the [[Everlasting Rime]], circa the {{yearlinkName|1489}}.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: By the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], Grimskalle became connected to the appearance of Auril in [[Faer√ªn]]. If her form on the [[Prime Material plane]] was destroyed, the fortress was believed to collapse in on itself.
document_data.Inhabitants:
As of the time of Auril taking up residence within Grimskalle, only one elderly frost giant named [[Ertgard]] remained within. He dedicated himself to the [[Aurilian]] faith.

Auril's [[roc]] companion [[Iskra]] nested atop the roof of Grimskalle, just as a number of [[ice mephit]]s sat along the walls like [[gargoyle]]s, and the particularly intelligent [[giant walrus]] called [[Ukuma]] dwelled within its dungeon.
